subject: Negotiation
title: The Power of Silence
description: A quick, practical guide to The Power of Silence.

hook.text: An American fills every silence. A Finnish negotiator uses silence as a weapon. Both think the other is strange.

buildup.text: In the US, silence is awkward. In Finland and Japan, silence shows thoughtfulness and respect.

discovery.text: Cultures comfortable with silence use it to process, signal importance, and create pressure.

twist.text: Americans often make their biggest concessions just to fill uncomfortable silence â€” giving away value for free.

climax.text: Learning to sit with silence is one of the most powerful cross-cultural negotiation skills.

punchline.text: Don't fear the pause. Master it.

quiz.question: How do Americans often react to silence in negotiations?
